type.name: DateTime
type.description: Represents a date and time in ISO 8601 format. Accepts shortcuts like `2021` to represent midnight Fri Jan 01 2021. Also accepts ISO 8601 durations strings which are added to the current date to create the represented date (e.g '-P2W1D' represents the date that was two weeks and 1 day ago)

type.name: Float
type.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

type.name: Boolean
type.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

type.name: Cycle
type.description: A set of issues to be resolved in a specified amount of time.

type.name: Project
type.description: A project.

type.name: ProjectMilestone
type.description: A milestone for a project.

type.name: Template
type.description: A template object used for creating entities faster.

type.name: User
type.description: A user that has access to the the resources of an organization.

type.name: ExternalUser
type.description: An external authenticated (e.g., through Slack) user which doesn't have a Linear account, but can create and update entities in Linear from the external system that authenticated them.

type.description: A user that has access to the the resources of an organization.

type.name: Float
type.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

type.name: Comment
type.description: A comment associated with an issue.

type.name: IntegrationService
type.description: Linear supported integration services.

type.name: ActorBot
type.description: A bot actor is an actor that is not a user, but an application or integration.

type.name: Favorite
type.description: User favorites presented in the sidebar.

type.name: Issue
type.description: An issue.

type.name: String
type.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.
